X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo
From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>

On 10/14/15 8:46 AM, anjackson@... [archive-crawler] wrote:
> We have been keeping (hard link) checkpoints so far, so we can try
> removing them. I believe this is just a matter of removing the
> checkpoint directory, yes?

Yes, but note that the checkpoint is split over multiple directories.

There's both the directory inside the 'checkpoints' directory, where 
small-components are serialized, and then the per-checkpoint 
subdirectories inside the BdbModule 'state' (BDB JE environment) 
directory. (Those are kept on the same volume as the environment so that 
the necessary log-files can just be instantly reused via the 
hard-linking mechanism, rather than facing the extra 
cost/delay/failure-modes of what might be a big copy to elsewhere.)

It's those checkpoint subdirs inside the 'state' directory that may be 
responsible for the disk use you're seeing â€“ but you'd want to remove 
all the files related to a single checkpoint for consistency.

- Gordon
